member.name: T:SharpMap.Data.Providers.DataTablePoint
member.summary: The DataTablePoint provider is used for rendering point data from a System.Data.DataTable.

remarks.para: The data source will need to have two double-type columns, xColumn and yColumn that contains the coordinates of the point, and an integer-type column containing a unique identifier for each row.

member.name: M:SharpMap.Data.Providers.DataTablePoint.#ctor(System.Data.DataTable,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the DataTablePoint provider
member.param: Instance of to use as data source.
Name of column where point's X value is stored.
Name of column where point's Y value is stored.

member.summary: Returns geometries within the specified bounding box

member.name: T:SharpMap.Data.Providers.Oracle
member.summary: Oracle dataprovider

remarks.para: This provider needs the Oracle software client installed on the PC where the application runs. If you need to connect to an Oracle database, it has to have oracle client (or Oracle Instant Client) installed.
You can download Oracle Client here: http://www.oracle.com/technology/software/index.html
If client don4t need an instance of Oracle, a better option is to use Oracle Instant client http://www.oracle.com/technology/tech/oci/instantclient/index.html
SharpMap Oracle provider by Humberto Ferreira (humbertojdf at gmail com).

members.member:
Initializes a new connection to Oracle
Connectionstring Name of data table Name of geometry column /// Name of column with unique identifier

member.name: T:SharpMap.Data.Providers.PostGIS
member.summary:
PostgreSQL / PostGIS dataprovider
Uses NPGSQL for communicating with database.
Detects PostGIS version and uses ST_Intersects method for PG_Verions >= 1.3 and && (bbox comparison) for others)

member.name: T:SharpMap.Data.Providers.SpatiaLite
member.summary:
SpatiaLite Provider for SharpMap
Spatialite is a spatial extension for the popular SQLite database engine.
In order to use this provider with SharpMap, you need to
get your copy of the native spatialite binaries from http://www.gaia-gis.it/spatialite/ ,
copy them all in one directory,
add a (or modify your) app.config- or web.config-file with key/value pairs SpatiaLitePath and SpatiaLiteNativeDll

member.name: M:SharpMap.Data.Providers.SpatiaLite.#cctor
member.summary: Initializes Provider with information about where to find native spatialite library and how it is named.

member.param: Connection string to connect to SQLite database file.

Name of the desired geometry column
Name of the object Id column

member.name: M:SharpMap.Data.Providers.SqlLite.CreateDataTable(SharpMap.Data.Providers.IProvider,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new table in a SQLite database and copies rows from an existing datasource.

remarks.para: The datatable created will contain six extra columns besides the attribute data: "oid" (Object ID row), "geom" (Geometry stored as WKT), and minx, miny, maxx, maxy for geometry bounding box.

member.param: Name of table to create (existing table will be overwritten!)
member.returns: Number or rows inserted, -1 if failed and 0 if table created but no rows inserted.

member.name: T:SharpMap.Layers.GeoTransform
member.summary:
The coefficients for transforming between pixel/line (X,Y) raster space, and projection coordinates (Xp,Yp) space.
Xp = T[0] + T[1]*X + T[2]*Y
Yp = T[3] + T[4]*X + T[5]*Y
In a north up image, T[1] is the pixel width, and T[5] is the pixel height. The upper left corner of the upper left pixel is at position (T[0],T[3]).
